item.title: Introducing the dividend comparison app
item.description: Why dividends? We tend to focus a lot on what happens right now and forget about the bigger picture. That is no different when investing in stocks. We are easily impressed by the recent rise in price and forget about why investors buy stocks. Well, the reason is that they hope that by owning a part of the company they get a part of the profits the company makes: Dividends!

item.title: Active Investor Signals
item.description: About the system The Active Investor Signals (AIS) system aims to trade individual stocks, stock index funds as well as a variety of ETFs adopting a medium to long term investment style. The criteria for investment are a mix of quantitative tests and discretionary decisions. Quantitative methods include backtesting of rule-based strategies and statistical analysis of historical price movements. Discretionary decisions gauge the quantitative elements in the light of macroeconomic cycles and money management.

Allocation 2/1/50:50 Not thinking too much about your finances: KISS If you don’t want to think about your finances keep things simple and stupid (KISS). Regularly invest a portion (I suggest 15%-20%) of your revenue in stocks (I suggest SPY) and government bonds (I suggest TLT).
